isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - CRUISE CONTROL, PTO, HAND THROTTLE SYSTEM - CRUISE ON/OFF SWITCH IN ON POSITION

svcproc.title: CRUISE ON/OFF SWITCH IN ON POSITION
svcproc.para: Momentarily placing this switch in the ON position causes the signal from ECM terminal 50 to go through the 2.2K ohm resistor located in the Resistor Block (390) through the ON terminal of the ON/OFF switch and returns to ECM terminal 39. With the ON switch depressed, the voltage drop in this circuit (measured between ECM terminals 39 and 50) is expected to be between 4.4 and 5.0 volts. A voltage between 4.4 and 5.0 volts is the signal the ECM expects to see with the ON switch depressed.
